column4: can't install pidgin... Depends: pidgin-data (<1:2.10.3-z) but 1:2.10.4-1ubuntu0+pidgin3.11.10 is to be installed
someone tell me how to resolve this error http://codepad.org/8W839Uxj
make sure you run "update" first
done
and did it fix your problem..?
didn't
have you run an upgrade lately (through update manager)? It could be that you need a new kernel for the lib. I suggest doing a full update/upgrade and a reboot, then try again.
done
should i also try install pidgin-ppa?
NO, ppa's are unstable and are not supported by the #ubuntu support channel
ok, i did sudo apt-get remove pidgin-ppa -- hope this is enough
LjL: About 50% of all update and install issues I've seen in this channel are caused by conflicts with PPA's for completly unrelated software (ex: skype PPA messing up GoogleEarth)
can u give me a list of good ppa's so that i disable the rest
I don't know of any good ones because I haven't had to use one in over 3 years
i just want ubuntu's default repos (i guess called ppa's too)
go into "software sources" and see if there are any 3rd party repositories in there
how to identify whether a repo is 3rd party?
just a sec, looking it up
what happened?
did you follow the instructions for ppa-purge?
finally worked
i had to remove pidgin-data manually, then install it manually again... dunno why i had to do it this way
weird, but at least it's working now :)
